abstract.text: An advanced interface for managing a data source object.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: Use the methods of this protocol to map between the positions of items and sections in your data source object and the positions of those same items and sections in your presented layout. Objects that adopt this protocol do so because the position of items in their data source object don’t always match the corresponding positions in their presented layout.
adopt this protocol and use it in conjunction with drag and drop operations. For example,

must account for the presence of placeholder cells, which appear as rows in the table but don’t have a corresponding entry in the data source object. Typically, you don’t adopt this protocol in your own classes.

abstract.text: Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your iOS, iPadOS, or tvOS app.
An object that manages an ordered collection of data items and presents them using customizable layouts.
The interface for initiating drags from a collection view.
An interface for coordinating your custom drop-related actions with the collection view.
The interface for handling drops in a collection view.
The data associated with an item being dropped into the collection view.
A placeholder for an item dropped on a collection view.
An object that contains information about a placeholder in the collection view.
Your proposed solution for handling a drop in a collection view.
A placeholder for an item dragged or dropped on a collection view.
An advanced interface for managing a data source object.
Translates an index in your presented layout to the equivalent index in your data source object.
Translates a section index in your presented layout to the equivalent section index in your data source object.
Performs actions on the current object using index paths that are relative to the presentation layer of that object.
Translates an index in your data source object to the equivalent index in your presented layout.
Translates a section index in your data source object to the equivalent section index in your presented layout.
A view that presents data using rows in a single column.
Initiate drags and handle drops from a collection view.

doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKi.title: Supporting Drag and Drop in Collection Views

abstract.text: The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.
